body:
According to my initial checks the forecastors that should have probabilistic capabilities and still need to be refactored are:

- [x] `ARIMA`,  `AutoARIMA` (inherit from same intermediate adaptor class) #1874
- [x] `AutoETS` #1874 
- [x] BATS/TBATS - https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/1842 by @k1m190r
- [x] `ThetaForecaster` - I am working on refactoring predict_quantiles and predict_intervals here https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/1579
- [x] `FBProphet` https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/1910

issue.title: [ENH] Probability Distributions in probabilistic forecasters

labels.name: implementing framework
labels.description: Implementing frameworks for new learning tasks

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**


We are currently working on refactoring the forecasting interfaces to allow probabilistic and interval predictions as described here https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/1687 and a high level summary included here https://github.com/sktime/enhancement-proposals/blob/main/steps/13_proba_forecasting/step.md

**Describe the solution you'd like**

We would like to include a way to return the probability distributions. We briefly discussed using methods from tensorflow, but are open to other suggestions.

**Potential issues**
This would introduce a new dependency.

issue.title: [ENH] - Naive variance prediction estimator

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
> #### Reference Issues/PRs
#1687 

> #### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.

@fkiraly 
As part of the probabilistic forecasting API, this will implement the `_predict_var` method to forecasters

> #### What should a reviewer concentrate their feedback on?

STEP [probabilistic forecasting API](https://github.com/sktime/enhancement-proposals/blob/main/steps/13_proba_forecasting/step.md)

> #### PR checklist

- [x] add `_predict_var` and its corresponding tag to the forecasting extension template.
- [x] add `NaiveVariance` composite class which implements the 'simple strategy' for variance prediction.
- [x] implement `_predict_var` and its corresponding in `NaiveVariance`.
- [x] implement `_predict_quantiles` in `NaiveVariance` where quantiles are inferred from a normal distribution. 
- [x] implement covariance prediction (`cov=True`)

> ##### For all contributions

- [x] I've added unit tests and made sure they pass locally.

It would look like we forgot `Prophet`!

issue.title: [ENH] Defaults for `_predict_interval` and `_predict_coverage`

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
This PR implements defaults for `_predict_interval` and `_predict_quantiles`, as proposed in #1877 - for discussion (not necessarily as final version). This does not yet contain defaults in terms of `_predict_proba`, since we have not settled on output format yet.

It is partly based on work in @k1m190r's PR #1842 and @kejsitake in #1579, behaviour moved to base class default implementations.

Behaviour implemented:
* if `_predict_interval`  is not implemented but `_predict_quantiles` is, it is called and outputs are reformatted
* if `_predict_quantiles`  is not implemented but `_predict_interval` is, it is called and outputs are reformatted
* the check whether sth is implemented is done by a utility added to `BaseObject`, a method `_has_implementation_of`, which is based on @k1m190r's utility that checks whether the forecaster has been refactored, which was based on @kejsitake's and some discussion between the three of us.

Further, the following forecasters were relying primarily on `_predict_quantiles` but interfacing interval prediction logic. This has been changed by tidying up the interface, implementing a leaner `_predict_interval`, and removing `_predict_quantiles`:
* `_PmdArimaAdapter`
* `_TbatsAdapter`
* `_ProphetAdapter`

Additional, minor changes:
* docstring fixes in `BaseForecaster`
* multiple minor instances of clean-up in the forecasting extension template
* shortened `ThetaForecaster` internals
* fix for bug in `ThetaForecaster`, where intervals were computed for 1-coverage, not coverage. Same in test for `ThetaForecaster`.
* fix for bug #1954 in `_ProphetAdapter`
* renamed `test_predict_pred_interval` to `test_predict_interval` for consistency with `test_predict_quantiles`

body: From our discussion on slack: @kejsitake has tentatively taken `Prophet` on for refactoring.

issue.title: Add predict_quantiles to FBprophet

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for contributing a pull request! Please ensure you have taken a look
at our contribution guide: https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

#### Reference Issues/PRs

See https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/1687
<!--
Example: Fixes #1234. See also #3456.

Please use keywords (e.g., Fixes) to create link to the issues or pull requests
you resolved, so that they will automatically be closed when your pull request
is merged. See https://github.com/blog/1506-closing-issues-via-pull-requests
-->


#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you have implemented.
-->

- Refactors `predict_quantiles` for FBProphet.
- Changes the test to only check if `pred_int['upper'] >= pred_int['lower']`.
- Implements a fix for when the X contains a variable named "ds", by copying the column to another column and renaming in the case the column is numeric and not an index. This is done in order to be more consistent with the other forecasters, which don't throw an error if exogenous X contains a column "ds" related to #1712.


<!--
Thanks for contributing!
-->

issue.title: [ENH] `predict_proba` for forecasters, `tensorflow-probability` dependency

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
Relates to #1746, proposes interface and technical solution.
Solves interface/framework for `predict_var` and `predict_proba` in #1687.

This PR adds `predict_proba` and `predict_var` interface and default behaviour to `BaseForecaster`:
* `predict_var` returns a `pd.DataFrame` of variance predictions
* `predict_proba` returns a `tfp` `Distribution` with batch indices corresponding to `fh` indices

The default behaviour is as follows:
* `predict_var` first looks if `predict_proba` is implemented, and gets variance there if it is. Otherwise, if intervals/quantiles are implemented, returns variance of a normal with same IQR as the predictions
* `predict_proba` uses `predict` as location and square root of `predict_var` as scale parameter. If `predict_var` is not directly implemented, leverages its default behaviour to get this from intervals/quantiles.

This PR also introduces a soft dependency on `tensorflow` and `tensorflow-probability`, localized to a `dl` dependency set.
This dependency set is added to dependency specifications where necessary; a function `_check_dl_dependencies` to check and raise error if the dependency is not installed is introduced.

Further, this PR turns on a number of tests to work for `predict_var` and `predict_proba`, by adding defaults for these methods to the scenarios.

Depends on the following PR:
* https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/2105
* https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/2108

body:
All done:
* framework functionality and default for `predict_proba` and `predict_var` was added in https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/2100
* defaults were added in https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/1879
* deprecation of `return_pred_int` is done in preparation for 0.11.0, #2271
